page.title: 09WEMBURY CHURCH
page.content: {St Werburgh's Church}is in a beautif- ul position by the sea. The Vicar is {Rev. Anthony Macey, who is also Rural {Dean and Chaplain of HMS Cambridge. The most important service is{Holy Co- {mmunion,}and the Vicar likes families to worship together in the family ser- vice.{John Galsworthy}wrote a fine poem about{Wembury Church.}There was a {Galsworthy Festival}here in 1983. In- side the church hang two flags - those of{Australia}and{Western Australia. {Major Edmund Lockyer}the founder of W.A.lived in{Wembury.}There was a big service in May 1984 to commemorate the bicentenary of his birth.{St Werburgh was a{royal princess,}the daughter of {King Wulfhere of Mercia.}She died c. 700AD.In the last 9 years there have been 162 weddings. The tomb of{Sir {John Hele}(d.1608)& his wife stands next to the altar.{Records begin 1611.
